business.headline: Cryptocurrencies here to stay as an asset class, says Ruchir SharmaIn an interview with India Today News Director Rahul Kanwal, Ruchir Sharma explained why cryptocurrencies, alongside gold, are emerging as long-term alternatives to traditional assets, particularly the US dollar.

China's stimulus may stabilise economy, but won't solve crisis: Ruchir SharmaIn an interview with India Today News Director Rahul Kanwal, Ruchir Sharma highlighted that China's growth is unlikely to exceed 2.5% annually over the next decade.

Only a weaker dollar will bring foreign investors back to India: Ruchir SharmaIn an interview with India Today News Director Rahul Kanwal, Ruchir Sharma explained that the primary factor hindering foreign capital inflows into India is the strength of the dollar.

Should India worry about Donald Trump's tariff plans? Ruchir Sharma explainsRuchir Sharma warned that under Donald Trump, India must brace for a more transactional approach, where deals could be made based on America's interests.

Booking plans job cuts as part of company's reorganisation planBooking Holdings, which owns brands like Booking.com and Kayak, did not disclose how many jobs would be affected but said it expected to provide more details on timing, likely impact on employees and financials "in due course".

Elon Musk's Tesla hits $1 trillion market value after Trump winThe electric automaker's shares jumped 8.2 per cent to $321.22, catapulting the company's valuation above the trillion-dollar mark for the first time in more than two years.

A woman's soulmate is another woman: Kalli Purie at Business Today MPW 2024Kalli Purie, Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief, India Today Group, delivered the vote of thanks at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 awards.

Watch: Trailblazers awarded at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024Business Today unveiled the 21st edition of its Most Powerful Women in Business list on Friday, celebrating 60 exceptional women leaders who are pioneering change, driving growth, and inspiring progress across diverse industries. This year's edition brings in 12 fresh faces and recognises four returning achievers, underscoring the dynamic nature of leadership in business. Watch the award ceremony here on India Today.

I salute the trailblazers: Kalli Purie at Business Today's Most Powerful Women eventKalli Purie, Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief, India Today Group, lauded the growing accomplishments and transformation of women leaders in India.

Trailblazers on Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 listThis year's Business Today Most Powerful Women list introduces 12 new faces, four returning achievers, and 37 repeat honourees from last year. Two trailblazers entered the MPW Hall of Fame after seven-time wins.

Americans can learn a lesson or two from India: Piyush Goyal on women representationUnion Minister of Commerce & Industry Piyush Goyal lauded India's approach to women's empowerment and said that Americans can learn a lesson or two from India on women representation.

Harley-Davidson tariffs to be cut after Trump's return? Piyush Goyal respondsSpeaking at the Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 event, Piyush Goyal expressed India's openness to reconsidering the tariffs on the iconic motorcycles.

Women leaders share insights on achieving work-life balance and success at BT MPW 2024At the Business Today MPW 2024 session, Ritu Arora, CEO & CIO of Allianz Investment Management, Asia Pacific, Nirupa Shankar, Joint MD of Brigade Group; and Devita Saraf, Chairperson & CEO of Vu Group, shared insights on striking a fine balance between work, life, health and wealth.

Women need to move from being savers to investors: Radhika GuptaSpeaking at the Business Today Most Powerful Women 2024 event, Radhika Gupta, MD and CEO of Edelweiss Mutual Fund, emphasised the need for women to move beyond saving and start investing.

It's not complicated: Radhika Gupta urges women to manage their own moneySpeaking at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 event, Edelweiss Mutual Fund Managing Director and CEO Radhika Gupta said that while women have been the "chief financial officers" of their households for generations, it's time to extend that role into the financial markets.

Women have always had a tough time breaking barriers in business: Padmaja Ruparel at BT MPW 2024Speaking at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 event, Padmaja Ruparel said women always had a tough time breaking barriers in business.

Zomato, Swiggy accused of unfair practices in food delivery market: ReportThe investigation found these companies implemented practices that gave preferential treatment to certain restaurants on their platforms.
Sensex, Nifty end in red as FII selling offsets IT gains; RVNL tanks 6%The S&P BSE Sensex dropped 55.47 points to settle at 79,486.32, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 89.95 points to 24,109.40.

Shiv Nadar, billionaire with a big heart, donates Rs 2,153 crore in FY24For the third time in five years, Shiv Nadar and his family have topped the EdelGive-Hurun India Philanthropy List 2024, contributing Rs 2,153 crore in the fiscal year 2024.

Sharan Hegde of 1% Club faces criticism after laying off 15% employeesPopular finfluencer Sharan Hegde is facing backlash after announcing layoffs at his company, 1% Club. His LinkedIn post has drawn criticism from many on social media.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: BJP's strong stand in Jharkhand: No tribal status for children of infiltratorsBJP chief JP Nadda vowed to revoke tribal rights for children of Bangladeshi infiltrators if the party was elected in Jharkhand.

Maharashtra, Jharkhand polls may follow national election trends: Ruchir SharmaAuthor Ruchir Sharma suggested that the upcoming Maharashtra and Jharkhand elections may follow recent Lok Sabha trends, citing a historical pattern. He, however, cautioned that each state election remains distinct.

BCCI verbally tells ICC India won't travel to Pakistan for Champions TrophyBCCI sources have confirmed to India Today that the Indian cricket team will not travel to Pakistan to play the Champions Trophy. While there has been no written communication between the BCCI and the ICC, the apex body has been communicated verbally.

Minor NEET student held hostage, raped for months in Kanpur, 2 teachers arrestedBoth teachers -- Sahil Siddiqui, who taught biology, and Vikas Porwal, who taught chemistry -- have been arrested and charged with offences of rape, wrongful confinement, criminal intimidation.

Won't have sex, US women vow as part of 4B revenge against men for Trump winA large number of women in the US are blaming men for Donald Trump's victory, and joining the 4B movement in protest. The 4B movement, which has its origins in South Korea, is about women vowing no sex, no relationships, no marriage and no childbirth.

Railway worker crushed to death while decoupling engine and bogie in BiharThe railway official was decoupling the engine of the Lucknow-Barauni Express when it unexpectedly reversed, resulting in the trapping of the official between the engine and one of the coaches of the train.

Qatar pulls out of Gaza mediation citing 'lack of serious willingness': ReportQatar, along with the US and Egypt, has been involved in months-long mediation aiming to end the conflict in Gaza and secure the release of Israeli captives held by the Iran-backed terror group.

PM slams Congress' 'divisive tactics': They can't tolerate OBC Prime MinisterPrime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday launched a scathing attack on the Congress, accusing the party of attempting to divide the Other Backward Classes (OBCs) for political gains.
How handbags are now the ultimate accessory for menMen have no need to shy away from pairing their outfit with a stylish handbag now, as this trend is taking the fashion world by storm.

CCTV captures moment massive blast ripped through Pak railway station, 25 killedThe blast took place inside the railway station when the Peshawar-bound express was about to leave for its destination, a senior police official said.

Should India worry about Donald Trump's tariff plans? Ruchir Sharma explainsRuchir Sharma warned that under Donald Trump, India must brace for a more transactional approach, where deals could be made based on America's interests.

Canada ends fast track visa programme, Indian students likely to be impactedIn a decision that is likely to impact several Indian students, Canada has ended its popular fast-track study visa programme. The move comes amid the ongoing diplomatic row between India and Canada.

Hum Saath Saath Hain turns 25: Can new-age stars recreate 90s family magic?Sooraj Barjatya's film Hum Saath Saath Hain, which remains popular for its portrayal of love, unity, and family values, completed 25 years. On the occasion, the actors of the 1999 film discussed the possibility of witnessing a sequel, capturing its timeless appeal, despite shifting industry trends.
Couldn't save samosas, yeh kya samvidhan bachayenge?Can the lords and saviours of the nation protect the Constitution if these saviours can't even save our savouries?

Can a fruit be non-vegetarian? Truth about figs!Figs have a fascinating formation process involving a crucial role played by wasps, leading many to question if they're non-vegetarian. Curious to know the answer? Read more.

Pak PM congratulates Trump, gets community noted for using X that he bannedPakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif congratulated Donald Trump using X, faced criticism for using the platform after banning it.

Game Changer teaser: Ram Charan promises an 'unpredictable' entertainerThe first full teaser of Ram Charan-starrer Game Changer is here. The S Shankar directorial also features Kiara Advani in a lead role.

The high cost of promises: Congress report card on guaranteesFive grand promises, one high-stakes gamble—as the Congress-led MVA courts Maharashtra's voters, a scrutiny of the party's track-record on welfare guarantees and their sustainability
Another sedan bags 5 star safety ratingThis model is the largest-selling sedan in India, having sold over 2,700,000 units since its entry into the country.

Patriarchy didn't stop Indira Gandhi from becoming PM: Nirmala SitharamanIf patriarchy stopped women from achieving what they want in India, how come Indira Gandhi made it as prime minister, asked Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.

Indians stuffed in train toilets, China moves billions with little fussMillions of travellers get added in India during the festive season, putting pressure on the railway network. But how has China managed its lunar holiday travellers, which is much higher than India's? This is the bigger story behind people stuffed in train toilets in India.

Video: Gujarati family holds 'funeral' for 12-year-old car, over 1,500 attendees joinA family in Gujarat bid farewell to their beloved 12-year-old car with a full-fledged burial ceremony. Several videos of the event went viral on social media.

Can artificial rain lessen air pollution in Delhi? Experts question effectivenessArtificial rain attempts to mimic the natural cleansing effects of rain on air quality. However, it introduces a pertinent question: can this method effectively reduce dust particles and overall pollution?

Why the stakes are high for Uddhav's Shiv Sena in Shivdi assembly seatFor the first time in almost 35 years, the bow and arrow symbol will be missing from EVMs in the seat from where the undivided Shiv Sena made its electoral debut

Zendaya, Anne Hathaway join Tom Holland and Matt Damon for Nolan filmHollywood stars Zendaya and Anne Hathaway will be joining Tom Holland and Matt Damon for the new untitled Christopher Nolan film, according to reports.

Game Changer teaser: Ram Charan promises an 'unpredictable' entertainerThe first full teaser of Ram Charan-starrer Game Changer is here. The S Shankar directorial also features Kiara Advani in a lead role.

Digvijay Singh Rathee on BB 18, Kashish Kapoor and his Splitsvilla daysModel and actor Digvijay Singh Rathee spoke to India Today Digital about his wildcard entry in Bigg Boss 18 alongside Kashish Kapoor. He addressed his Splitsvilla controversy, shared his thoughts on co-contestant Vivian Dsena, and identified those he perceived as fake on the show.

Kangana Ranaut's grandmother dies: Was painful to see her bed-riddenKangana Ranaut mourned the death of her grandmother, Indrani Thakur. In her tribute, the actor called her a remarkable woman and an inspiration to the family.

sports.headline: ISL, 1000th match: Mumbai City draw Chennaiyin FC 1-1 in action-packed gameMumbai City FC rode on left-back Nathan Rodrigues' strike to hold Chennaiyin FC 1-1 in a thrilling draw in the Indian Super League in Chennai on Saturday. This was also the 1000th match of the tournament.

Injury scares overshadow Vinicius hattrick in Madrid's win over OsasunaVinicius Jr. led Real Madrid's triumphant return to form with a hat-trick against Osasuna, but the victory was overshadowed by fresh injury concerns for Rodrygo, Militao, and Vazquez, adding uncertainty to Madrid's lineup in upcoming matches.

2nd T20I, Weather Report: Will rain play spoilsport in Gqeberha?South Africa vs India: The action shifts to Gqeberha after India beat South Africa in Durban. Here's the update on the weather conditions.

2nd T20I Predicted XI: Dayal, Vyshak debut on cards in Gqeberha?South Africa vs India, 2nd T20I: India will look to extend their run in the T20I series in the second game. After a commanding win, India might want to change their line-up slightly to accommodate debutants.

Dubey heroics takes Vidarbha closer to innings win over Himachal PradeshHarsh Dubey's career-best bowling figures propelled Vidarbha to a dominant innings-and-88-run victory over Himachal Pradesh, securing their fourth consecutive win and extending their lead in Ranji Trophy Group B.

Haryana's Yashvardhan Dalal slams 426 against Mumbai in Col. CK Nayudu TrophyYashvardhan Dalal smashed an unbeaten 426, the highest individual score in Col. CK Nayudu Trophy history, powering Haryana to 732/8 against Mumbai. His record-breaking knock featured 46 fours and 12 sixes, cementing his place among the tournament's finest performers.

BCCI verbally tells ICC India won't travel to Pakistan for Champions TrophyBCCI sources have confirmed to India Today that the Indian cricket team will not travel to Pakistan to play the Champions Trophy. While there has been no written communication between the BCCI and the ICC, the apex body has been communicated verbally.

Social media can be harsh: Jemimah Rodrigues welcomes ICC's new AI toolIn a virtual media interaction, Jemimah Rodrigues has praised the ICC for trying to curb abuse on social media in the women's game. The world board recently conducted a trial, successfully, during the T20 World Cup in the UAE.

South Africa vs India, 2nd T20I live-streaming: When and where to watchSuryakumar Yadav's India team heads into the second T20I against South Africa with renewed confidence, aiming to maintain dominance, while Aiden Markram's side seeks redemption after their strategic shortcomings in the series opener at Durban.

UP Yodhas and U Mumba kick off second leg of Pro Kabaddi League in NoidaThe Noida leg of PKL Season 11 kicks off with UP Yoddhas seeking redemption against U Mumba, while Gujarat Giants aim for revenge against Haryana Steelers. Intense battles and high-stakes kabaddi promise to electrify the Noida Indoor Stadium!

Intense battles and high-stakes kabaddi promise to electrify the Noida Indoor Stadium!

2 hundreds in 5 years: Ponting concerned about Virat Kohli's formFormer Australia captain Ricky Ponting believes that Virat Kohli's form in Test cricket is a little bit concerning. Ponting pointed out that Kohli has scored 2 hundreds in the last 5 years.

Jake Fraser-McGurk not fussed about poor form ahead of IPL mega-auctionYoung Australian batter Jake Fraser-McGurk is not fussed about his poor run of scores in white-ball cricket. Fraser-McGurk said that he believes there is no reason to hit the panic button.

Jemimah Rodrigues hits maiden fifty for Brisbane Heat, wins Player of the MatchJemimah Rodrigues starred with the bat for Brisbane Heat against Adelaide Strikers in the WBBL match. She scored 61 runs from 40 balls to help Brisbane Heat beat the Strikers by 8 runs.

Ancelotti clears retirement talks amidst Real Madrid form: Will have to fire meReal Madrid's Carlo Ancelotti reaffirmed his commitment to the club despite recent setbacks, emphasizing his focus on improving performance and dismissing any thoughts of retirement amid swirling rumors about his future.

Australia 'committed' to aggressive batting despite MCG failure: Coach McDonaldAustralia's head coach Andrew McDonald believes the team, led by Pat Cummins, will stick to its ultra-aggressive batting style despite suffering a heavy nine-wicket defeat to Pakistan in the second ODI.

Smriti Mandhana fails to impress on debut for Adelaide Strikers in WBBLSmriti Mandhana made her debut for Adelaide Strikers and failed to make a mark in the Women's Big Bash League 2024. She managed only 6 runs and was dismissed by Shikha Pandey of Brisbane Heat.

Smriti Mandhana vs Jemimah Rodrigues: Star India batters reflect on WBBL faceoffSmriti Mandhana and Jemimah Rodrigues reflected on their face-off in the Women's Big Bash league match between Adelaide Strikers and Brisbane Heat.

Happy with where I am: Alexander Zverev satisfied with his performance in 2024World No. 2 Alexander Zverev is thrilled with his 2024 performance, feeling renewed after a tough recovery from his 2022 French Open ankle injury.

Australia 'committed' to aggressive batting despite MCG failure: Coach McDonaldAustralia's head coach Andrew McDonald believes the team, led by Pat Cummins, will stick to its ultra-aggressive batting style despite suffering a heavy nine-wicket defeat to Pakistan in the second ODI.

Sanju Samson's wife reacts to hundred vs Proteas: My forever favourite heroSanju Samson's wife Charulatha reacted to her husband's scintillating hundred vs South Africa in Durban. She took to Instagram and captioned her story, "My forever favourite hero" alongside Samson's picture.

Neeraj Chopra joins Javelin great Jan Zelezny's training groupDouble Olympic medalist Neeraj Chopra has announced his new collaboration with javelin legend Jan Železný as his coach. The partnership aims to refine Chopra's technique and elevate his performance to new heights.

Are India being fair to Rinku Singh? Aakash Chopra questions batter's spotAakash Chopra has questioned the Indian team management's decision to always send Rinku Singh down the order at No.6. The southpaw hasn't got a lot of chances to perform in recent times with the bat.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
